units.title: Passaging and lentiviral infection of hiPS cells
units.text: CAG::Cas9;Dlxi1/2::eGFP hiPS cells were passaged with accutase 1 day before infection with the lentiviral library (with 5 µg ml−1 polybrene).
units.rationale: This is a specific, actionable step in the protocol involving cell handling and viral infection conditions.

units.title: sgRNA and Cas9 nucleofection for gene editing
units.text: CAG::Cas9;Dlxi1/2::eGFP hiPS cells were dissociated with accutase and 0.5 million cells were mixed with 300 pmol of sgRNAs and 40 pmol of Cas9 protein (Synthego, SpCas9 2NLS Nuclease (1,000 pmol)).
units.rationale: This describes a precise, quantitative procedure for CRISPR-mediated gene editing using nucleofection.

units.title: FACS selection of mCherry+ cells after lentiviral infection
units.text:
Three days later, mCherry+ cells were selected by FACS (collected
Real-time qPCR was performed using the SYBR Green PCR Master Mix (Thermo Fisher Scientific, catalogue no. 4312704) on a QuantStudio 6 Flex Real-Time PCR System (Thermo Fisher Scientific, catalogue no. 4312704).
units.rationale: This is a key procedural step for isolating successfully infected cells using fluorescence-activated cell sorting.

units.title: Immunofluorescence staining protocol
units.text: Fixed hiPS cells and cryosections were blocked in 10% normal donkey serum (NDS) (MilliporeSigma, catalogue no. S30-M) and 0.3% Triton X-100. PBS was used to wash away excess primary antibodies, and the cryosections were incubated with secondary antibodies in PBS containing 10% NDS and 0.3% Triton X-100 for 1
units.rationale: This outlines the critical blocking, washing, and secondary antibody incubation steps for immunofluorescence staining.

units.title: hCO 3D-to-2D image processing for Dlxi1/2b::eGFP analysis
units.text: The boundary of the assembloid in individual frames was manually delineated using the nuclear stain signal (roughly every 40 frames); these boundaries were used to create an Imaris ‘surface’ to define the hCO (Supplementary Video 1). The 3D hCO was then reduced into a two-dimensional (2D) projection using the maximum intensity function in Fiji. To measure the Dlxi1/2b::eGFP intensity in a consistent manner for all samples, the hCO-hSO boundary was aligned vertically.
units.rationale: This is a detailed, multi-step image processing protocol essential for consistent quantification of fluorescent signal in organoids.

units.title: Live imaging of SEC61B-mEGFP+ cell migration
units.text: The samples were placed in the controlled environment for 1 h before imaging. Samples were imaged at a depth of roughly 12 μm and a rate of 10 min per frame for roughly 20 h.
units.rationale: This specifies the precise imaging conditions and duration for tracking cell migration dynamics.

units.title: Analysis of saltatory migration in hCO/hSO
units.text: To analyse the percentage of saltatory migrating cells in hCO or hSO showing ER displacement, SEC61B-mEGFP+ cells showing saltatory migrations (ER displacement). The hCO or hSO with at least three saltatory moving cells were included to analyse ‘the percentage of cells with ER displacement’.
units.rationale: This defines the inclusion criteria and analytical method for quantifying specific cell migration behavior.

units.title: Electroporation of ganglionic eminences with CRISPR components
units.text: Using a sterile, pulled and bevelled glass micropipette, ganglionic eminences were locally coinjected with a CAG-driven GFP plasmid (pCAG-IRES-GFP, gift from C. Cepko through Addgene, plasmid no. 11159, ref. 59) mixed with either a sgRNA–Cas9 complex (Synthego) directed to mouse Lnpk or Cas9 protein alone. Randomly picked slices were electroporated with horizontally oriented pad-paddle electrodes at 50 V using a BTX Square Pulse electroporator
units.rationale: This is a detailed, reproducible procedure for targeted CRISPR delivery via electroporation in brain slices.

units.title: Image analysis for cell migration using Fiji and Blinding
units.text: Fiji (ImageJ, v1.0 and v1.53f51, and ImageJ2, v.2.3.0/1.53q) was used to analyse the migration of SEC61B-EGFP+ cells. Blinding for genotype was used for analysis.
units.rationale: This combines the software tool and critical experimental design principle (blinding) for unbiased image analysis.
